IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: LIST OF EXHIBITS Meta Exigence Response (1 2) Verizon Exigency Request Form Verizon Exigency Request Response NARRATIVE On 11/21/2023, at approximately 0900 hours, the Maryland State Police Computer Crimes Unit received a phone call from a concerned citizen, Jackson Sande (202-701-9292), who stated that at approximately 0027 hours, on 11/21/2023, Mr. Sande observed concerning comments on an Instagram post. Mr. Sande took screenshots of the comments with his cell phone and attempted to email them to a Maryland State Police email address, but the email did not successfully send. TFC Mueller worked Mr. Sande and instructed him to send the screenshots to TFC Mueller. At approximately 1000 hours, Mr. Sande sent the screen shots to TFC Mueller who observed the following comments from Instagram account ashtonextraction_: Comment 1: Im right there with you the Dhhs office in Maryland needs to answer the fucking phone and respond to calls before I start shooting at these African-Americans or Ill just take it to the sheriffs department Comment 2: Its been 30 days all you guys need to do at the DHHS office is to return our calls instead of starving our family three months in a row throughout the whole year. The comments were commented onto a video, which was posted by the prisonbarss Instagram account, but have since been deleted. Mr. Sande continued to state that viewed ashtonextraction_s account and observed videos were he made threats to the PD talking about tossing a gasoline cocktail in their car in another video that he has now deleted. At approximately 1015 hours, TFC Mueller completed a Meta Exigency Request for the ashtonextraction_ Instagram account. While doing so, TFC Mueller conducted a search of the Instagram account and observed the Maryland Registration plate 7DF7298 to be exposed in an image. TFC Mueller conducted a registration check and observed the vehicle to be co-owned by Frank Forsyth Willson III (W/M DOB 8/31/1961) and Frank Forsyth Willson IV (W/M DOB 2/12/1992), with a registered address, for both owners, of 17613 Sir Galahad Way, Ashton, MD 20861. At that time, TFC Mueller contacted the Montgomery County Police Department for assistance with the investigation. TFC Mueller spoke with Sgt. Drengwitz and Officer Bachhuber who stated they would handle the investigation, but requested the Maryland State Police continue to assist with technical hurdles. At approximately 1100 hours, TFC Mueller received the Meta Exigency response, which provided the following pertinent information: IP Address 72.83.195.179 Time 2023-11-21 04:08:50 UTC TFC Mueller conducted an open source check of the IP address, through Maxmind, and observed it to be registered to Verizon Fios and geo-locate to the Ashton area. At that time, TFC Burnett, of the Maryland State Police Computer Crimes Unit, completed and Exigency Request for IP address subscriber information, and submitted it to Verizon. At approximately 1227 hours, Investigators received the following information from Verizon: Customer Name: Frank Willson Account Address: 1700 ASHTON RD UNIT MAIN HSE, , ASHTON,MD 208610000 Daytime Telephone 9999999999 Email Address: text-decoration:underline">willsonfrank92@gmail.com Evening Telephone 9990909090 All information was provided to Officer Bachhuber, who will lead the reminder of the investigation. This concludes the Maryland State Polices involvement with this investigation. It should be noted that due to the nature of the off the offense, the RMS needs a victim for the report to be submitted. There the victim of John Doe was entered. CASE TRANSFERRED TO MONTGOMERY COUNTY POLICE DEPARTMENT.
